me.wobblyyyy.pathfinder2.utils

Class DualJoystick

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.wobblyyyy.pathfinder2.utils.DualJoystick

  • public class DualJoystick
extends java.lang.Object
    A combination of two joysticks with a couple of utility methods.
    Since:
    0.1.0
    Author:
    Colin Robertson

      A DualJoystick has four axes.

      • getAxisValue

        public double getAxisValue(DualJoystick.Axis axis)
        Get the value of a given axis.
        Parameters:
        axis - the axis to get the value of.
        Returns:
        the value of the provided axis.

      • translation

        public Translation translation()
        Get a translation with the following default values:
        • Forwards/backwards axis: left y
        • Right/left axis: left x
        • Turn axis: right x
        Returns:
        a translation formed with translation(Axis, Axis, Axis).

      • translation

        public Translation translation(DualJoystick.Axis forwardsAxis,
                               DualJoystick.Axis strafeAxis,
                               DualJoystick.Axis turnAxis)
        Get the translation formed by three of the joystick's axes.
        Parameters:
        forwardsAxis - the axis responsible for controlling forwards and backwards motion. This is typically a Y axis.
        strafeAxis - the axis responsible for controlling left and right motion. This is typically an X axis.
        turnAxis - the axis responsible for controlling turning. This is typically an X axis.
        Returns:
        a translation formed by the values of the joystick's axes.
